title: For Iraqi Christians, Return To Captured City Is A Fraught Mandate
teaser: Archbishop Emil Nona, the head of the Chaldean church in Mosul, Iraq, was out of town when ISIS captured his city. Now, he is going back to Mosul, as are some 50 Christian families. He knows the dangers, but he says he must tend his flock.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
